info.game_comments:
2004-A Kids Week game 2.
From Washington, D.C.

(1, 1).clue: During the war General Thomas Conway suggested that this man be replaced as commander-in-chief

(3, 1).clue: The Old Testament ends with the book of Malachi & starts with this book

(4, 1).clue: ...a set of pom-poms so she can practice being one of these, right in her bedroom -- go team!

(5, 1).clue: Before a race you might hear Ready...this...Go!!!

(6, 1).clue: Viewers of my show, "Reading Rainbow", got all wrapped up in Aliki's book about "Mummies Made in" this country

(1, 2).clue: The first of the Intolerable Acts closed this city's harbor as retribution for a certain "Party"

(3, 2).clue: In the Bible she's created from a man's rib

(4, 2).clue: ..."Justified", the debut solo album from this 'N Sync artist

(5, 2).clue: It's what you do when you put 2 + 2 together, or 1 + 1 for that matter

(6, 2).clue: In "The Paper Crane" by Molly Bang, a paper bird made from this art form magically comes to life

(1, 3).clue: His signature on the Declaration of Independence is the largest of the 56

(3, 3).clue: In his own book, this Hebrew prophet is swallowed by a great fish & coughed up 3 days later

(5, 3).clue: It's where people go to "work out"

(6, 3).clue: A little brown bat who is raised among birds shines bright in this modern classic

(1, 4).clue: While commander at West Point, he met with British major John Andre to plot the surrender of the fort

(3, 4).clue: The 4 gospels of the New Testament

(5, 4).clue: It's the main ingredient in a candle

(6, 4).clue: In a Grimms' fairy tale, this strange little man helps a miller's daughter spin straw into gold

(1, 5).clue: At this June 17, 1775 battle, the patriots were ordered not to "fire until you see the whites of their eyes"

(3, 5).clue: One popular version of the Bible is the one completed in 1611 & named after this English king

(5, 5).clue: In tennis, it's a high, arcing shot that ideally lands in play behind your opponent

(6, 5).clue: In "Meanwhile Back at the Ranch", Elna Hicks starts to dig for potatoes & gets rich by striking this liquid

(1, 1).clue: Most of this capital's drinking water comes from the Thames River with smaller amounts from the River Lee

(2, 1).clue: One recipe for making these chocolate-covered insects begins by saying, "Catch" them "at a Picnic Site"

(3, 1).clue: Before he was president George H.W. Bush served as U.S. ambassador to this organization from 1971 to 1973

(4, 1).clue: Emma Watson made her acting debut as this bookish friend of Harry Potter

(5, 1).clue: Sometimes part of an orchestra, it's the heavenly instrument heard here

(1, 2).clue: Inhabitants of this European capital are called Madrilenos

(2, 2).clue: The book "Fashionable Food" says the worst salad of the 1920s contained bananas & this movie theatre snack

(3, 2).clue: She & Barbara are the twin daughters of Laura Bush

(4, 2).clue: Ian Holm plays this older hobbit in the first "Lord of the Rings" film

(5, 2).clue: The name of this instrument can also refer to a body part

(1, 3).clue: After World War II, this city was divided into 4 occupation zones: American, British, French & Russian

(2, 3).clue: Eek!  We found a recipe for gumbo that calls for the diamondback type of this "noisy" snake

(3, 3).clue: Neil Bush's daughter Lauren has worked as one of these for the likes of Tommy Hilfiger & Harry Winston

(4, 3).clue: This "Sabrina" star has a production compay called Heartbreak Films

(5, 3).clue: You might hear this instrument when visiting Honolulu

(6, 3).clue: An arcade game that keeps your feet moving:DDR

(1, 4).clue: The column of King Sigismund in this Polish city honors the king who moved the capital there from Krakow in 1596

(2, 4).clue: Don't tell Pumbaa that the Carnivore Restaurant in Nairobi has served the meat of this bumpy-headed African pig

(4, 4).clue: Jinkies!  It wasn't too much of a stretch for him to play Fred in the "Scooby-Doo" movies

(5, 4).clue: A wandering minstrel could make good use of this handheld percussion instrument heard here

(1, 5).clue: Romania's capital, Bucharest, is not to be confused with this capital of Hungary

(4, 5).clue: He's the Nick star seen here

(6, 5).clue: A "chronological" region on the U.S. West Coast:PST

(0, 0).clue: Florida is one of these, Michigan is made up of several & Alaska is the biggest one in the Americas
